DOC.brief_title: DIR/ Floortime™ Parent Training Intervention Children With Developmental Disabilities
DOC.detailed_description: The objective study test whether add parent train program use relationship-based approach could help child development disability ( DDs ) would confer additional benefit routine clinical care available group term improve development reduce behavior problem . The study treatment involve intervention entirely parent child DDs , rather directly child . Before first session , parent intervention group learn DIR/ Floortime™ model approach 1 - hour one one coaching ( begin oft study , end 1st 3rd month ) 2 hour DVD lecture pocket book . The parent intervention group ask carry FloortimeTM together use Floortime strategy daily activity minimum 15 hour per week . Meanwhile , child control group continue routine care . The baseline assessment follow time schedule similar intervention group .
DOC.criteria: The child developmental disability : 1. age 2 6 year age 2. ambulatory 3. living primary caregiver least 6 month . The child exclude : 1. autism 2. deaf 3. blind 4. serious medical problem ( e.g . severe congenital heart disease , intractable seizure ( seizure frequency least one attack per month six month despite receive two anticonvulsant drug ) 5. parent : literate , know chronic psychiatric , physical illness
